Passions

Like most geeks, I have multiple (sometimes conflicting) professional passions:

Computer Programming

Drafting and Design

Automotive Technology

Computer Programming

Javascript: Node.js, React, SASS, Express.js

I started developing Javascript in 2001, I had a love/hate relationship with JS ever since. Just recently, when ES6 was released I was once again enchanted by it's simple to use, hard to master ways. I also have some Angular 2 experience, but don't have anything in my portfolio at this time

DOM: HTML5, CSS3

Okay, so HTML and CSS3 are not programming languages, they are markup and style sheets. I'm willing to bet, even C++ developers need to know this stuff, so I do as well.

C++

I learned C++, like many other people in College. I have developed multiple applicatons for BeOS, I mostly use this in my arduino development.

Drafting and Design

Fusion 360

After I learned autocad, I breifly was able to use a competing parametric CAD (pro-e). I loved the software, however it was too pricy for a home hobbyist, same with solidworks. When Autodesk came out with Fusion 360, and made it free (for the most part) to hobbyists I switched immediately. I currently don't get in there very often, but when I do, I generally make custom Mini-ITX computer cases for my friends and family

AutoCAD

I started working with AutoCAD in the 1990's with version 12, and kept up with the software until AutoCAD 2014. I have designed multiple computer enclosures using it's drafting board like features. I have since left AutoCAD for Fusion 360.

3D Printing

I own a Creality CR-10 printer. I have printed using ABS, PLA, and TPU. Mostly I use it for Computer case parts, and for VW heater door "foam fix kits"

Automotive Technology

VW Registered Technician

I've been working on my VWs since I was a kid, My first one was a 1984 grey market GTI. I owned that one for about 2 years, then got into other imports. I got bit by the Diesel bug in 1995 with the Passat TDI debut. Fast forward to 2004 I pick up a used 1999 Golf TDI AT; My life has been with VW ever since. I have owned a TDI that, at the time it sold had 750,000 miles.
